info.name: KryptoTrac MCP Server
info.description:
Test collection for the KryptoTrac MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server.

**Note:** The MCP server uses stdin/stdout for communication, not HTTP. This collection is provided for documentation and reference purposes. To actually test the MCP server, use the command line or the SDK.

## How to Use

These requests show the JSON format for each tool. Use them as reference when:
1. Building MCP clients
2. Testing with `echo` commands
3. Integrating with CI/CD
4. Developing custom tools

## Example Command Line Usage

```bash
echo '{"tool":"check_bb_status"}' | node scripts/kryptotrac-mcp.js
```

## Documentation

Full documentation: `docs/mcp/README.md`

request.description:
Check Backend Bot (BB) status.

## Purpose
Verifies that the BB system is active and synced with ATLAS.

## Request Format
```json
{
  "tool": "check_bb_status"
}
```

## Success Response
```json
{
  "tool": "check_bb_status",
  "ok": true,
  "status": "BB-ACTIVE",
  "message": "BB is awake, responding, and synced with ATLAS. I got you.",
  "timestamp": "2025-11-15T08:30:48.876Z"
}
```

## Command Line Usage
```bash
echo '{"tool":"check_bb_status"}' | node scripts/kryptotrac-mcp.js
```

## SDK Usage (TypeScript)
```typescript
const client = new KryptotracMCPClient();
const status = await client.checkBBStatus();
if (status.ok) {
  console.log('BB Status:', status.status);
}
```

## Documentation
See `docs/mcp/tools/check_bb_status.md` for full documentation.

request.description:
Read persona configurations from the application.

## Purpose
Extracts and lists persona configurations defined in `app/lib/persona/persona.ts`.

## Request Format
```json
{
  "tool": "read_personas"
}
```

## Success Response (personas exist)
```json
{
  "tool": "read_personas",
  "ok": true,
  "personasDetected": ["defaultPersona", "adminPersona", "guestPersona"],
  "lineCount": 150
}
```

## Error Response (file not found)
```json
{
  "tool": "read_personas",
  "ok": false,
  "error": "persona.ts not found"
}
```

## Command Line Usage
```bash
echo '{"tool":"read_personas"}' | node scripts/kryptotrac-mcp.js
```

## SDK Usage (TypeScript)
```typescript
const client = new KryptotracMCPClient();
const personas = await client.readPersonas();
if (personas.ok) {
  console.log('Personas:', personas.personasDetected);
}
```

## Documentation
See `docs/mcp/tools/read_personas.md` for full documentation.

Check available routes in the ATLAS subsystem.

## Purpose
Inspects and lists all routes defined in the `app/atlas` directory.

## Request Format
```json
{
  "tool": "check_atlas_routes"
}
```

## Success Response
```json
{
  "tool": "check_atlas_routes",
  "ok": true,
  "routes": ["page.tsx", "layout.tsx", "api.ts"],
  "count": 3
}
```

## Error Response (directory not found)
```json
{
  "tool": "check_atlas_routes",
  "ok": false,
  "error": "ATLAS directory not found"
}
```

## Command Line Usage
```bash
echo '{"tool":"check_atlas_routes"}' | node scripts/kryptotrac-mcp.js
```

## SDK Usage (TypeScript)
```typescript
const client = new KryptotracMCPClient();
const routes = await client.checkAtlasRoutes();
if (routes.ok) {
  console.log('Routes:', routes.routes);
}
```

## Documentation
See `docs/mcp/tools/check_atlas_routes.md` for full documentation.

Read recent application logs.

## Purpose
Reads and returns the last 20 lines from `logs.txt` in the project root.

## Request Format
```json
{
  "tool": "read_logs"
}
```

## Success Response
```json
{
  "tool": "read_logs",
  "ok": true,
  "logs": [
    "2025-11-15 08:30:00 - Server started",
    "2025-11-15 08:30:05 - User authenticated",
    "..."
  ]
}
```

## Error Response (file not found)
```json
{
  "tool": "read_logs",
  "ok": false,
  "error": "logs.txt not found"
}
```

## Command Line Usage
```bash
echo '{"tool":"read_logs"}' | node scripts/kryptotrac-mcp.js
```

## SDK Usage (TypeScript)
```typescript
const client = new KryptotracMCPClient();
const logs = await client.readLogs();
if (logs.ok) {
  logs.logs.forEach(log => console.log(log));
}
```

## Documentation
See `docs/mcp/tools/read_logs.md` for full documentation.
